dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: SYF Offers Greater Flexibility With Apple Pay's Pay Later Feature
News Content: Synchrony Financial SYF recently made the Pay Later feature of Apple Pay available to eligible Synchrony Preferred Mastercard, Synchrony Plus World Mastercard or Synchrony Premier World Mastercard holders. The specified cardholders now have the flexibility to either utilize their credit card's standard terms or take advantage of a promotional offer featuring fixed monthly payments at checkout.

To utilize a Synchrony Mastercard with Apple Pay, cardholders must first add their card to Apple Wallet. When making purchases online or in app, using Apple Pay on an iPhone or iPad, customers can select their Synchrony Mastercard. If eligible, they can select the Pay Later option to view available promotional offers. They can then choose their preferred option and complete the fast and convenient checkout process with Apple Pay.

Apple Pay offers a secure, private and convenient payment experience for its users. When using a Synchrony Mastercard with Apple Pay, transaction details remain confidential, as Apple does not store any information associated with the user's purchases.

Synchrony plans to extend the option to pay for eligible purchases using fixed monthly payments to a broader range of Apple Pay users within its portfolio of co-branded cards. Later this year, customers will also gain the ability to view and redeem rewards from eligible Synchrony-issued cards while checking out online or in app on iPhone and iPad with Apple Pay.

Therefore, the ulterior motive of Synchrony behind the recent announcement remains to offer a greater level of choice and flexibility to its customers at the time of checkout. The availability of a suitable financing solution that removes the need to make lumpsum payments and does not exert pressure on one’s finances may boost the purchasing power of consumers.

Benefits of the Recent Move to Synchrony

The facility of providing simplified digital transactions and addressing the diversified credit needs of customers is expected to attract newer customers to Synchrony as well as retain existing ones. Increased utilization of Synchrony’s credit cards may bring growth in interest and fees on loans, from which SYF mainly earns its revenues. Interest and fees on loans advanced 10.5% year over year in the first nine months of 2024.

The well-earned reputation of SYF can be attributed to its digital and analytics expertise. A series of acquisitions and partnerships, coupled with tech investments, have strengthened the company’s digital arm. This, in turn, has fetched several program agreements with some of the nation’s leading retailers and manufacturers.

Story Continues

SYF’s Share Price Performance & Zacks Rank

Shares of Synchrony have gained 89.6% in the past year compared with the industry’s 24.5% growth. SYF currently carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).Zacks Investment Research

Image Source: Zacks Investment Research

Stocks to Consider

Some better-ranked stocks in the Finance space are Intercorp Financial Services Inc. IFS, Ameriprise Financial, Inc. AMP and Civista Bancshares, Inc. CIVB. While Intercorp Financial Services sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) at present, Ameriprise Financial and Civista Bancshares carries Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) each. You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.

The bottom line of Intercorp Financial Services outpaced estimates in three of the last four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 36.17%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for IFS’ 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 48.2% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 9% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for IFS’ 2025 earnings has moved 0.7% north in the past 60 days.

Ameriprise Financial’s earnings outpaced estimates in three of the trailing four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 0.99%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for AMP’s 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 14.6% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 7.6% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for AMP’s 2025 earnings has moved 0.4% north in the past 30 days.

The bottom line of Civista Bancshares outpaced estimates in three of the last four quarters and missed the mark once, the average surprise being 7.72%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for CIVB’s 2025 earnings suggests an improvement of 8.2% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for revenues suggests growth of 6.4% from the 2024 estimate. The consensus mark for CIVB’s 2025 earnings has moved 1.5% north in the past 30 days.

Shares of Intercorp Financial Services, Ameriprise Financial and Civista Bancshares have gained 28.2%, 45.8% and 21.8%, respectively, in the past year.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Synchrony Financial's new Pay Later feature integrated with Apple Pay, which is expected to enhance customer flexibility and potentially increase transaction volumes. This could lead to higher revenues for Synchrony, positively impacting its stock price. However, since the news primarily concerns Synchrony and not Apple directly, the impact on Apple's stock price may be limited. Given Apple's strong market position and the potential for increased usage of Apple Pay, there is a moderate probability of a positive impact on AAPL's stock price. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive development for Apple Pay through increased flexibility offered by Synchrony Financial's Pay Later feature. This could lead to increased Apple Pay adoption and usage, potentially boosting Apple's revenue. However, the direct impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be moderate as Apple Pay is just one of many revenue streams for Apple. The news primarily benefits Synchrony Financial. The article focuses more on SYF than AAPL. Therefore, the positive impact on AAPL is likely to be small. Given the overall market conditions and other factors influencing Apple's stock, the probability of a rise is slightly higher than a fall, but not significantly so.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news focuses on Synchrony Financial (SYF) and its expanded partnership with Apple Pay, offering a 'Pay Later' option.  While this is positive for SYF, the news article does not directly impact Apple (AAPL). The increased usage of Synchrony's credit cards through Apple Pay could indirectly benefit Apple through increased transaction volume, but this effect is likely to be small and diffuse.  The article primarily highlights the positive impact on SYF's revenue growth and customer acquisition.  Therefore, the news is largely irrelevant to Apple's stock price movement.  Any price movement in AAPL would likely be due to other market factors and not this specific news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on Synchrony Financial's (SYF) integration with Apple Pay's Pay Later feature, which is expected to enhance customer flexibility and potentially increase card usage. While this development is positive for SYF, it does not directly impact Apple Inc. (AAPL) in a significant way. Apple Pay is already a well-established service, and this news does not introduce any groundbreaking changes or financial implications for Apple. Therefore, the impact on AAPL's stock price is likely to be neutral or marginal.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Synchrony Financial's (SYF) recent announcement to offer Apple Pay's Pay Later feature to its eligible Mastercard holders. This move aims to provide greater flexibility and purchasing power to consumers. While the news is primarily about Synchrony Financial, it also mentions Apple Pay, which is a service provided by Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, the direct impact of this news on Apple's stock price seems limited as the announcement is more about Synchrony's payment options. The news might have a slightly positive effect on Apple's stock due to the expanded use of Apple Pay, but it's not a significant enough catalyst to drive a substantial stock price movement. Therefore, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling are relatively balanced, with a slight inclination towards a positive impact due to increased Apple Pay usage.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article discusses the partnership between Synchrony Financial (SYF) and Apple Inc. (AAPL) to offer the Pay Later feature of Apple Pay to eligible Synchrony cardholders. This feature provides customers with greater flexibility and convenience at checkout, potentially increasing purchasing power and driving growth in interest and fees on loans for SYF. Although the article primarily focuses on SYF, the partnership can also positively impact AAPL by enhancing the user experience of Apple Pay. Given the positive implications of this partnership, it is likely that the stock price of AAPL will rise due to this news.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news indicates a strategic partnership and expansion between Synchrony Financial (SYF) and Apple Inc., which provides more flexible payment options for customers using Apple Pay. This initiative could lead to increased usage of Synchrony's credit cards, boosting revenue from interest and fees. However, the news directly impacts Synchrony Financial rather than Apple Inc., and it doesn't suggest direct financial benefits for Apple Inc. Therefore, the probability analysis focuses on Synchrony Financial.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on Synchrony Financial's new Pay Later feature integrated with Apple Pay, which is expected to enhance customer flexibility and potentially increase transaction volumes for Synchrony. While this could indirectly benefit Apple through increased usage of Apple Pay, the direct impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be limited. Most analyses suggest a moderate positive sentiment towards AAPL due to the potential for increased Apple Pay adoption, but the overall impact is not significant enough to warrant a high probability of stock price movement. Therefore, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling, reflecting the positive sentiment but acknowledging the limited direct impact.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on Synchrony Financial's (SYF) integration with Apple Pay's 'Pay Later' feature. While this is undoubtedly positive for SYF, its direct impact on Apple (AAPL) is likely to be limited. Apple Pay is already a well-established service, and this news doesn't introduce any groundbreaking changes or financial implications for Apple. The previous rounds of predictions show a wide range of opinions, with some models suggesting a slight positive impact and others considering it neutral. Given the trend of previous predictions and the nature of the news, I believe the impact on AAPL will be slightly positive, but not significant enough to warrant a high probability of a stock price rise. The news primarily benefits SYF, and any positive impact on AAPL is indirect and likely to be small.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on Synchrony Financial (SYF) and its enhanced Apple Pay integration. While this is positive for SYF, the direct impact on Apple (AAPL) is minimal.  Increased Apple Pay usage might indirectly benefit Apple, but this effect is likely small and difficult to quantify. The news doesn't introduce any significant changes to Apple's core business or financials.  Considering the previous predictions, which range widely from 0.1 to 0.7 for a price rise, and the lack of direct impact on Apple's fundamentals, a neutral stance is most appropriate.  The probability of a price rise is slightly higher than a fall due to the potential, albeit small, for increased Apple Pay transaction volume, but this is likely to be overshadowed by other market factors influencing AAPL's price.

While this development is positive for SYF, the direct impact on Apple Inc. (AAPL) is limited. Given the neutral to slightly positive impact, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly higher than a fall, but not significantly so.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article primarily focuses on Synchrony Financial's (SYF) integration with Apple Pay's Pay Later feature, which is expected to enhance customer flexibility and potentially increase card usage. While this development is positive for SYF, the direct impact on Apple's stock price seems limited as the announcement is more about Synchrony's payment options. The increased usage of Apple Pay could indirectly benefit Apple through increased transaction volumes, but this effect is likely to be small and diffuse. Given the overall market conditions and other factors influencing Apple's stock, the probability of a significant stock price movement due to this news is relatively balanced.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news article discusses the partnership between Synchrony Financial (SYF) and Apple Inc. (AAPL) to offer the Pay Later feature of Apple Pay to eligible Synchrony cardholders. This feature provides customers with greater flexibility and convenience at checkout, potentially increasing purchasing power and driving growth in interest and fees on loans for SYF. Although the article primarily focuses on SYF, the partnership can also positively impact AAPL by enhancing the user experience of Apple Pay. Given the positive implications of this partnership, it is likely that the stock price of AAPL will rise due to this news. Considering the predictions of other models, which range from a slight inclination towards a positive impact to a more significant positive effect, the overall trend suggests a moderate to high probability of the stock price rising.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The financial news highlights a strategic partnership and expansion between Synchrony Financial (SYF) and Apple Inc., which provides more flexible payment options for customers using Apple Pay. While the article focuses more on Synchrony Financial, it implies that this feature could lead to increased usage of Apple Pay, potentially benefiting Apple Inc. (AAPL) by enhancing the user experience and possibly increasing transaction volumes. However, since the core impact of the news is on Synchrony Financial, the direct financial benefits for Apple Inc. are limited. The previous predictions suggest a moderate to high probability of a positive impact on AAPL's stock price, though not overwhelmingly significant.
